output:
I'm not sure how to interpret "The bad movie was good!" as it seems contradictory. If you meant to say the movie wasn't actually bad, then it would be positive: "The bad movie wasn't so bad after all!"

If instead, you intended to claim that a bad movie turned out to be surprisingly enjoyable or well-made, then it could still be considered a positive sentiment. Let me know how you'd like to phrase this!
